content:
a procedure when one senator literally kills a bill by talking against it
a senator calls attention to a part of a bill that they (and the country) disagree with
it brings the entire attention of the world on the chamber

there is no talking limit in the senate, so a filibuster is indefinite in length; however, there are two conditions: you just can’t sit down and you can’t stop talking
you can also take questions and audibly read to fill time and keep talking and rest voice

filibuster can be stopped by quorum call
